comment.text: @jrische The `update.upgrade_desktop_encrypted_64bit` automatic test is known to be broken (a race condition) at the moment, it's safe to waive the gating failure (if there's no other failure) and allow it to go stable.

bugs.title: Exhaustive SPDX license expression in specfile

bugzilla.short_desc: Exhaustive SPDX license expression in specfile

long_desc.thetext:
The current SPDX license expression used in krb5 specfile[1] is incomplete. This is due to the fact some licenses were not registered in the SPDX license list[2].

I submitted unknown licenses to the fedora license git repo:

  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/461
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/462
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/463
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/464
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/465
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/466
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/467
  https://gitlab.com/fedora/legal/fedora-license-data/-/issues/468

They confirmed some of them were not registered, so I submitted them to the SPDX license project:

  [Brian-Gladman-2-Clause]        https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2342
  [CMU-Mach-nodoc]                https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2345
  [OpenVision]                    https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2346
  [BSD-2-Clause-Copyright]        https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2348
  [HPND-export-US-ext-disclaimer] https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2349
  [HPND-export-US-2disclaimers]   https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/2350

They are gradually being reviewed. The SPDX license expression should be updated once all of them made their way to the official license list.


[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/krb5/blob/rawhide/f/krb5.spec#_79
[2] https://spdx.org/licenses/

Reproducible: Always

bugs.title: TRIAGE CVE-2024-26458 krb5: Memory leak at /krb5/src/lib/rpc/pmap_rmt.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: TRIAGE CVE-2024-26458 krb5: Memory leak at /krb5/src/lib/rpc/pmap_rmt.c [fedora-all]

long_desc.thetext:
Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.21.2 contains a memory leak in /krb5/src/lib/rpc/pmap_rmt.c.

References:

https://github.com/LuMingYinDetect/krb5_defects/blob/main/krb5_detect_1.md

Created krb5 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2266732]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2024:3268 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:3268

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2266731

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2266731,2266732

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
